statement:
If $f$ is a continuous complex function on the rectifiable curve
$\gamma$ of the complex plane, then $$\begin{aligned}
\left|\int_\gamma f(z)\,dz\right| \leqq \max_{z\in\gamma} |f(z)|\cdot l,\end{aligned}$$
where $$l = \int_\gamma|dz|$$ is the of $\gamma$.

The form of (1) concerning the continuous real function $f$ on the
interval $[a,\,b]$ is
$$\left|\int_a^b f(x)\,dx\right| \leqq \max_{a\leqq x\leqq b} |f(x)|\cdot(b\!-\!a).$$

For applications of this important theorem, see the example of using
residue theorem.
